comments: If a(n)=1, then n is prime and 2^n-1 is a Mersenne prime. - _Franz Vrabec_, Sep 27 2005Using the first variant A007917 (rather than A151799) of the prevprime() function, the sequence is well defined for n=1, with a(1) = 2^1 - prevprime(2^1) = 2 - 2 = 0. - _M. F. Hasler_, Sep 09 2015
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=2..5000
author: James Kilfiger (mapdn(AT)csv.warwick.ac.uk)
extensions: Extended to a(1) = 0 by _M. F. Hasler_, Sep 09 2015
